title: Purka Mountain
text: Purka Mountain () is a prominent <a href="mountain">mountain</a> ridge with two outliers, about 5 nautical miles (9 km) southeast of <a href="Mount%20Gjeita">Mount Gjeita</a> in the <a href="Hansen%20Mountains">Hansen Mountains</a>. Mapped and named Purka (the sow) by Norwegian cartographers working from air photos taken by the <a href="Lars%20Christensen%20Expedition">Lars Christensen Expedition</a>, 1936–37.
